tweets.text: We're mounting a wide-ranging investigation into reports of damage to the #RiverLugg, which is protected through SSSI status. We're treating this very seriously, working with @NaturalEngland & @ForestryComm who have taken immediate action to prevent any further works at the site. https://t.co/bvhnTETfal
@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency A new armour. A new attitude and new actions! Thank you :)

urls.title: Police move in after Herefordshire river bulldozed and straightened
urls.description: Witness describes damage to mile-long stretch of Lugg as egregious act of ‚Äòecological vandalism‚Äô

tweets.text: @seasonalight @EnvAgency @Blodeuweddmoon @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm Hi Ginny it was outside Kingsland according to this article. https://t.co/dMAaiObMXO

Great piece by @janehardyjones & spot on to focus on the need to both #mitigate & #adapt to #climatechange as it's happening now - not in the future!  #StormDesmond #Lancashire @EnvAgencyNW https://t.co/tHfKzTQRx6

domain.name: Interests and Hobbies Vertical
domain.description: Top level interests and hobbies groupings, like Food or Travel

tweets.text:
A mile of the River Lugg has been bulldozed to destruction.
Bankside trees grubbed out & burnt.
Riverbed scraped out.
Meanders reprofiled.
Disaster for downstream wildlife.
This was an SSSI.
No consent was sought. 
@EnvAgency must surely prosecute this.
RT
https://t.co/cSBhrR2nDW

@DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Well done - EA Drone operator surveying damage at River Lugg at Kingsland site this afternoon - picture editors more at Alamy Live News @guardian @guardianphotos #riverlugg @TelegraphPics https://t.co/SBFVor1VIu
@NaomiLWood @EnvAgency I'm liking your thinking. :)

@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency It was, at least, reported on #bbcradio4 this morning. I think a prosecution, hefty ¬£2million fine and full cost of restoration by proper river people is the least that should happen to the perpetrators. Can the land be confiscated?

@BluesomeH @RobGMacfarlane @EnvAgency Flooding from River Lugg has caused major damage.
Personally the whole stretch needs dredging to prevent further flooding in Herefordshire.
#r4today 

https://t.co/KiXQTJlvxo

We‚Äôve used our powers of entry at the River Lugg #Herefordshire incident

14 specialist officers from @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil now on site gathering information & evidence. https://t.co/LLCOFQHCox
@sanc_sir @EnvAgency @ChrisUn77749348 @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm Farmers are working flat out day & night to put food on your table. Give it a rest

@JustinFrenchBr1 @Blacky_Himself @EnvAgency That Justin is exactly where we separate. It is the board's job to manage the CEO and it is the board's job to ensure that the organisation is capable of not only operating effectively but delivering on its goals and objectives. 

If the board aren't up to that job they should go
@EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm Can you confirm exactly when the @EnvAgency were informed about this incident?

Shocking ecological vandalism - perpetrator must be prosecuted to "fullest extent possible", conservationists say @EnvAgency @DaveThroupEA @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil https://t.co/Evs30iKXkl

When certain things happen, it's easy (and fair) to be angry with @EnvAgency but even @Feargal_Sharkey will agree coal-face EA staff, especially in Fisheries & Biodiversity teams are hard working, passionate people doing hard jobs. It's the backbone of the top brass that fail us

Sites in #Crawley got a surprise early knock on the door as we we're out with @BTPSussex  and @crawleybc and @WeAreOpenreach checking sites and looking for metal theft.

As well as seizing a vehicle, we'll do further investigations and consider appropriate enforcement action. https://t.co/YQjwx47fj5

"Be in no doubt that anything less than a prosecution and full restoration of the river, paid for by the perpetrator, will be acceptable‚Äù.

@EnvAgency and others want to prove they are fit for the 21st century? Here's your chance. https://t.co/ji0wmcYyhf
Thank you @EnvAgency please keep at it. It's a shocking tragedy but if proper action is taken it could deter others who think it's somehow ok to rip up habitats like this. https://t.co/4UllZ5an3m

Curiouser and curiouser.

The redoubtable @bettwsresident CEO of @WUFoundation making it very clear  that @EnvAgencyMids were alerted to the destruction that was taking place on the River Lugg last week. 

Did EA the respond? If not why not.

Starts 8:37

https://t.co/XbNCDTpqIL

Our @salmonstour project will re-naturalise the River Stour, restoring natural flow, helping the river to clean itself & providing new habitat for wildlife. We need YOUR help to do so. Retweet & use the tag #BBCWildlifexEcover to help secure @EcoverUK funding #FertilisetheFuture https://t.co/pkEdU8RlP5
Why, oh why, did it take the Environment Agency SO LONG to act? The public deserve an explanation. @EnvAgency https://t.co/8wSLRzgFx5

Global Commission on Adaptation Commissioner @EmmaHowardBoyd outlines the @EnvAgency new flood strategy that prepares #UK coastal communities for #climatechange. 

It's just one example of a #ResilientRecovery. To learn more, join us for #AdaptationWeek: https://t.co/j91yOklfzi https://t.co/gtXXNru3ag
